data.question: What is the chemical formula for the nickel-based MOF single crystal mentioned in the text?
data.answer: Ni-TBAPy-SC

data.question: What method was used to measure the binding energies in the study?
data.answer: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS)

data.question: Based on the synthesis conditions provided, what is the temperature and duration for the solvothermal route used to prepare the yellow rhombic single crystal Ni-TBAPy-SC?
data.answer: The autoclave was heated at 120 °C for 72 hours

data.question: How does the BET surface area of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts compare to that of Ni-TBAPy-SC?
data.answer: The BET surface area of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts is significantly higher than that of Ni-TBAPy-SC

data.question: What role does the uncoordinated hydroxyl oxygen atom in the H4TBAPy ligand play in the stability of Ni-TBAPy-SC in aqueous solution?
data.answer: The uncoordinated hydroxyl oxygen atom acts as acid-base buffer sites to protect the Ni-TBAPy-SC from aqueous solution

data.question: Is the Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelt photocatalyst stable in a wide range of pH aqueous solutions?
data.answer: Yes, the Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelt is stable in a wide range of pH aqueous solutions

data.question: Does the photocatalytic activity of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for hydrogen evolution require an additional cocatalyst?
data.answer: No, the photocatalytic water splitting to produce hydrogen can be efficiently driven free of cocatalyst

data.question: What is the role of the [Ni3O16] nickel oxide cluster in the Ni-TBAPy-SC MOF?
data.answer: The [Ni3O16] nickel oxide cluster acts as the catalytic center for water splitting to produce hydrogen

data.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the effective coordination between H4TBAPy and Ni2+ in Ni-TBAPy-SC?
data.answer: Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectroscopy was used to confirm the effective coordination

data.question: What is the apparent quantum efficiency (AQE) of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for hydrogen evolution under 420 nm irradiation?
data.answer: The AQE of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for hydrogen evolution under 420 nm irradiation is 8.0%

data.question: How does the photocatalytic hydrogen evolution rate of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts compare to that of the single crystal under visible-light irradiation?
data.answer: The photocatalytic hydrogen evolution rate of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts is about 164 times higher than that of the single crystal

data.question: Is the photocatalytic water splitting performance of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts affected by the presence of sacrificial agents?
data.answer: Yes, the photocatalytic water splitting performance of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts is affected by the presence of sacrificial agents

data.question: What is the effect of the 2D structure of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts on its photocatalytic activity?
data.answer: The 2D structure of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts enhances active surface areas and decreases charge transfer resistance, promoting surface catalysis and charge separation

data.question: What is the significance of the uncoordinated hydroxyl oxygen atom in the H4TBAPy ligand for the chemical stability of Ni-TBAPy-SC?
data.answer: The uncoordinated hydroxyl oxygen atom in the H4TBAPy ligand acts as acid-base buffer sites, contributing to the excellent chemical stability of Ni-TBAPy-SC in aqueous solutions

data.question: Does the photocatalytic activity of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for hydrogen evolution improve with the use of ascorbic acid as a sacrificial agent?
data.answer: True, the use of ascorbic acid as a sacrificial agent improves the photocatalytic activity of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for hydrogen evolution

data.question: What experimental method was used to investigate the electronic structural property of the Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts?
data.answer: Mott–Schottky measurements were used to investigate the electronic structural property of the Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts

data.question: How does the photocatalytic hydrogen evolution performance of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts compare to that of H4TBAPy-NiOx?
data.answer: The photocatalytic hydrogen evolution performance of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts is significantly higher than that of H4TBAPy-NiOx

data.question: Is the photocatalytic water splitting mechanism of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts based on a ligand-to-metal charge transfer (LMCT) process?
data.answer: True, the photocatalytic water splitting mechanism of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts is based on a ligand-to-metal charge transfer (LMCT) process

data.question: What is the role of the pyrene-containing ligand in the Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for its photocatalytic activity?
data.answer: The pyrene-containing ligand in the Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts favors electron transfer and contributes to the extraordinary water reduction activity

data.question: Does the photocatalytic performance of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for hydrogen evolution depend on the light source wavelength?
data.answer: True, the photocatalytic performance of Ni-TBAPy-NB nanobelts for hydrogen evolution depends on the light source wavelength
